content.text: Select a Tower for more information

"Terrorists have invaded the country! 
Defeat the terrorists and survive the attack!"

events.comment: Change music according to comm support

parameters:
"Tensions are getting high! Place down Community
Leaders near all grouped towers!"
"Cheerleaders boost morale among citizens, and keeps the country motivated to move on."
"Caring citizens give a listening ear to those in need and will help them if necessary."
"Volunteers step up to help when there is a need for it, no matter the circumstances."

events.comment: TODO: Make Leader give free upgrade

parameters: "Leaders are able to solve problems within a community, effectively and efficiently."
"Career Guiders help lead people into suitable jobs that the country needs."
"Investors help fund new companies and support existing local businesses."
"Soldiers are the first line of defence against physical threats to Singapore."
"Intelligence helps detect and deter threats before they can be executed."
"Not only do Firefighters fight fire, they also help out in many other aspects as well."

events.comment: TODO: Make Towers not die when in range of doctor after implementing death

parameters: "Doctors treat health conditions to help the community live better."
"White-hat hackers have good intentions, and prevent their bad counterparts from doing damage."
"Dicerning Citizens tell lies from truth online and take appropriate responses against them."

parameters:
"Your towers have been hacked by unidentified cybercriminals, reducing their fire rate!
Beware of the internet trolls and defeat them before they slow your towers down further!"

"Terrorists have invaded the country! 
Defeat the terrorists and survive the attack!"

objects.name: DeathText
objects.string: The enemies broke through your defences and destroyed the country!

content.text:
You survived all the waves and defended the country!
Congratulations!

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteSlider
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
description: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value. The slider can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use sliders in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

eventsBasedObjects.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteSlider

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the label that is displayed over the thumb.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

parameters: max(Background.BoundingBoxRight(), max(Label.BoundingBoxRight(), Thumb.BoundingBoxRight())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxLeft(), min(Label.BoundingBoxLeft(), Thumb.BoundingBoxLeft()))
max(Background.BoundingBoxBottom(), max(Label.BoundingBoxBottom(), Thumb.BoundingBoxBottom())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxTop(), min(Label.BoundingBoxTop(), Thumb.BoundingBoxTop()))

events.comment: The parent size is not defined in onCreate so it needs to be done here.

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum value of the slider.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxValue

eventsFunctions.description: the step size of the slider.
eventsFunctions.name: StepSize

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BackButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds interactions with the back button.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Prevents the back button from quitting the game and provides a condition to check when it's pressed (to allow customising its behavior).

inlineCode: history.pushState("", ""); // Push a new fake state as the old one was popped
// Handle back button on the web
history.pushState("", ""); // Push a fake state to prevent switching page when clicking on back

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers whenever the player presses the back button.
eventsFunctions.name: onBackButtonPressed

eventsFunctions.description:
This simulates the normal action of the back button. 
This action will quit the app when in a mobile app, and go back to the previous page when in a web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: doDefault

inlineCode: // Close the app on cordova, as this is the default behavior
// Go to previous page as it is the default on browsers
// Remove the listener so new fake states don't get pushed
history.back(); // Remove the state that prevents going back
